newsitem.title: GREECE: MORGAN STANLEY ISSUES CALL WARRANT ON GREEK SHARES.
newsitem.headline: MORGAN STANLEY ISSUES CALL WARRANT ON GREEK SHARES.

text.p: Morgan Stanley Jersey Ltd issued two million American-style, drachma-denominated call warrants on a basket of eight Greek shares involved in infrastructure works.
The warrants will be privately placed with institutional investors in Greece and abroad.
Lead manager is Morgan Stanley International joined by co-lead manager Sigma Securities for the domestic placement. The warrants will be listed in Luxembourg.
The issue date is April 10 with the call warrants maturing in one year.
The underlying stock basket has as follows:
The strike price is 11,000 drachmas, 10 percent out-of-the-money.

The warrants are cash settled and cleared through Euroclear and Cedel. The minimum trading lot is 1,000 warrants. The underlying stock basket is out-of-the-money at 10,000 drachmas and the initial premium is 1,350 drachmas.
The basket's initial value, 10,000 drachmas, is based on the average ask price of the included shares during the three working days prior to the issue date -- April 10.
